security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution beyond standard git and GitHub CLI operations. Uses only documented shell commands for branch checking, status review, and PR creation via gh CLI. No filesystem access beyond git repository, no environment variable reading, no network calls outside expected GitHub API endpoints.

content.user_title: Create GitHub pull requests with templates
content.value_statement: Creating pull requests manually takes time and often results in incomplete descriptions. This skill automates PR creation with structured templates, ensuring consistent documentation and faster code reviews.
actual_capabilities: Checks current branch and git status before creating PR
Reviews commit history against main branch
Pushes local branches to remote with tracking
Creates PRs with structured markdown descriptions
Adds labels, assignees, and target branches to PRs
Generates completion reports with PR URL and details
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Only works with GitHub repositories, not other Git hosting services
Does not handle merge conflicts or failed checks
Cannot create PRs without appropriate repository permissions

use_cases.title: Streamline PR workflows
use_cases.description: Quickly create well-documented pull requests with consistent templates and test checklists

use_cases.title: Submit quality contributions
use_cases.description: Generate professional PR descriptions that help maintainers review and merge contributions faster

use_cases.title: Improve review documentation
use_cases.description: Ensure every PR includes clear summaries and test plans for faster, more effective reviews

prompt_templates.title: Create a simple PR
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to create a basic pull request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pull request with the title '[Brief description]' describing my changes

prompt_templates.title: PR with test checklist
prompt_templates.scenario: When preparing a PR with testing requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pull request titled '[Feature name]' and include test checklist items: [Test item 1], [Test item 2]

prompt_templates.title: PR to non-main branch
prompt_templates.scenario: When targeting a different base branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a draft PR for my feature branch targeting the 'develop' branch with summary of changes

prompt_templates.title: Full PR with labels
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need all PR options configured
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pull request with title '[Your title]', base branch 'main', assign to me, add 'enhancement' label, and include this summary: [Your summary]

output_examples.input: Create a pull request titled 'Fix login timeout bug' with test checklist items: verify login works, check session expiry

best_practices: Run git status and review changes before creating a PR to ensure only intended modifications are included
Use descriptive titles that summarize the change in under 60 characters for better visibility
Fill in all test checklist items to help reviewers understand what verification is needed
anti_patterns: Creating PRs without reviewing the diff first may include unintended changes
Using vague titles like 'fix' or 'update' makes it harder to track changes in project history
Skipping the test plan makes it difficult for reviewers to verify the implementation works correctly

faq.question: Does this skill work with GitLab or Bitbucket?
faq.answer: No, this skill uses GitHub CLI (gh) and only works with GitHub repositories.

faq.question: What permissions does the GitHub CLI need?
faq.answer: GitHub CLI requires authentication and repo scope permissions to create pull requests.

faq.question: Can I create draft pull requests?
faq.answer: Yes, use the --draft flag when creating a PR to mark it as a draft requiring more work.

faq.question: Is my code or data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: Code is only sent to GitHub via the official gh CLI when creating a PR. No third-party services.

faq.question: What if the PR creation fails?
faq.answer: The skill will report any errors from gh CLI such as permission issues or branch conflicts.

faq.question: How is this different from manual PR creation?
faq.answer: This skill provides templates, automates branch pushing, ensures consistent description format, and reduces setup time.
